intro: Chomelia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican chomelia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Chomelia costaricensis is often found in the understory of lowland rainforests, where it thrives in humid conditions.
